title: Scary moment as West Virginia coach Bob Huggins collapses
text:
Manage Scary moment as West Virginia coach Bob Huggins collapses West Virginia coach Bob Huggins fell to the floor in the first half of Monday's game against Texas. — SI College Hoops (@si_ncaabb) February 21, 2017 There was a scary moment late in the first half of West Virginia’s game against Texas Monday, when Mountaineers head coach Bob Huggins collapsed to the court and needed to be helped up. Huggins eventually made his way back to his stool and appeared to be OK, and as players came over and hugged him, he seemed to have a sense of humor about it. It looked like he told a player, “You’re going to kill me.” Huggins finished coaching the first half and went into the locker room under his own power as the Mountaineers held a 46-32 lead. UPDATE 
Official #WVU word is that Huggins was "lightheaded." Huggins himself says his defibrillator gave him a bit of a jolt, but he's "fine."
